sentences.sContent: Calvinism was the most convenient religion since the days of the ancients.
sentences.sContent_eng: Calvinism was the most convenient religion since the days of the ancients.
sentences.sCn: 加尔文主义是自古以来最方便的宗教。

sentences.sContent: American society in 19 th century - led by American " Calvinism " and Presbyterian Church.
sentences.sContent_eng: American society in 19 th century - led by American " Calvinism " and Presbyterian Church.
sentences.sCn: 19世纪美国社会与文化的主流，由长老会，美国版本的加尔文主义领导！

sentences.sContent: He was a restless activist who tried to point England in the direction of Calvinism. later in 1559 following study under Calvin;
sentences.sContent_eng: He was a restless activist who tried to point England in the direction of Calvinism. later in 1559 following study under Calvin;
sentences.sCn: 他是一个忙碌不息，企图指引英国朝着加尔文主义方向的积极分子。 1559年他跟随加尔文学习。

trans.tranCn: 加尔文教义， 加尔文主义
trans.tranOther: the Christian religious teachings of John Calvin, based on the idea that events on Earth are controlled by God and cannot be changed by humans
